turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hi! I’d like a large black coffee, please.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Hi, what do you want?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I’d like a decaf drip, to go.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like our light or dark roast?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I'll just have whatever's freshly brewed.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Are you sure you don’t want to try an espresso, an Americano, or a latte?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No, just a decaf coffee.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Sure, no problem. Would you like it hot or cold?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hot, please.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like any room for cream?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No, thanks.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like some sweetener? A couple of pumps of syrup maybe?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No, I’ll add a couple of packets of sugar myself.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I added some foam from another drink to your coffee by accident. I’ll have to start over. Did you say you wanted the light or dark roast?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Forget it. Let’s keep it simple. Give me a cup of tea.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Would you like that hot or cold, sweetened or unsweetened, loose leaf or in a tea bag?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I want a cold.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay, sure here your coffee.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You are welcome. See you next time.
